intro: Euthrixia salsoloides, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or inland deserts. Euthrixia salsoloides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
